Log in as a user in a Collect workspace 2. Navigate to Workspaces → Rules → confirm Rules section is unavailable 3. Create a new expense in NewDot 4. Observe that: The Reimbursable toggle is not shown 5. Expense is created as non-reimbursable 6. Submit and approve the report 7. Attempt to mark report as Paid. ## Expected Result: Collect workspaces should default all expenses to reimbursable (consistent with Classic), or Users should be able to toggle reimbursable status manually on expense creation. ## Actual Result: Expenses default to non-reimbursable, Reimbursable toggle is missing, Report cannot be marked Paid after approval. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.22-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176877/test-cases/41237357 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Applausetester+track1@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Pre-condition: Have atleast one expense in existing workspace moved via share it with your accountant 1. Launch app 2. Login with expensifail account 3. Open self DM 4. Create a manual expense 5. Tap share it with accountant 6. Select a user 7. Select an existing workspace 8. Create expense 9. Note new expense created is shown in seperate report 10. Immediately open the expense 11. Note within seconds, expense disappears and "report has no expenses"is shown 12. Tap back and note new expense is added with first expense as same report ## Expected Result: Newly created expense should consistently remain in its own report, without disappearing or merging back with another report. ## Actual Result: The expense briefly appears in a separate report, disappears upon opening, shows “Report has no expenses”, and then re-merges with the first expense in the original report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/955bd675-d90b-4cb6-b4a1-fb26ec72c729 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Ensure the focus in the chat switcher does not change when the API results get in

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1759408797916159) ### Problem ``` 1. CMD+K to open the chat switcher 1. Type a few letters 1. Hit arrow down to go to the 3rd result 1. Go to press enter to switch to 3rd result 1. API request completes 1. Focus jumps to 1st result, and I press enter on the 1st result by mistake ``` ### Solution Make sure to keep the focus on the row that the user switched to, even after the API results populate. That means the content of the option row can change, but if you clicked down to third row, you will remain on third row

title: [$250] [CRITICAL] Add the Create Report option when editing Report field on expenses

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 Doc section: Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 # Feature Description This adds the Create Report option when the user edits the Report field on an expense that is already reported. So, the user goes to a workspace chat, clicks on an open report, then clicks on an expense, and then clicks on the Report field. They should see the Create Report option and the following should happen when they click it: - If the user has a default group workspace --> Create the report in the default workspace - If the user doesn't have an active workspace but has only one group workspace --> Create the report in that workspace - If the user has no active workspace but has multiple group policies --> Ask the user to pick the workspace where the new report should be created # Manual Test Steps 1. Have a user with 3 workspaces: A, B C. A is the default workspace 2. Have an open report with at least one expense in the workspace C 3. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, and then click on the Report field 4. Verify that you see the Create Report option. Click on it 5. Verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the active workspace A 6. Have another expense in the same open report from workspace C 7. Delete the active workspace A 8. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, then click on the Report field, and then click on Create Report 9. Verify that you are asked to choose if you want to create the new report in workspace B or workspace C 10. Pick the workspace B and verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the workspace B 11. Have another expense in the same open report from workspace C 12. Delete the workspace B 13. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, then click on the Report field, and then click on Create Report 14. Verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the workspace C
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021973752558473855732
  • Upwork Job ID: 1973752558473855732

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.22-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71480 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** duytestnguyen+new135@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Android 16 / Pixel 7A/ Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: Create new account and new workspace 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to Workspace chat 3. Tap on Create expense 4. Swipe to Manual tab (Important) 5. Create an manual expense 6. Split the expense 7. Tap on one of splited expense 8. Tap on 'Report' field 9. Tap on 'Remove from report' 10. Navigate back to Workspace chat 11. Create new expense in new report 12. Repeat Step 7-9 ## Expected Result: The expense should be removed from report and moved to personal space ## Actual Result: Tap on 'Remove from report' nothing happen at Step 9 and Step 12. Expense report can not be deleted in More > Delete also Issue will happen everytime after that even when you log out and log in to new other account, create 1 expense in workspace and remove it from report. Workaround: clearing cached ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/222ec303-4c7e-4a88-bb95-e360209cd269 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.22-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1121/folder/13176744/41237142/929687227 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** gocemate+b2154391@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Go to FAB> Track distance> Map 2. Add Start and Stop location 3. Verify map preview displays the map 4. Go offline 5. Go online ## Expected Result: Map should be displayed when user switch back online ## Actual Result: No map preview when switch to offline to online mode ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven���t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.22-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70362 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsdnoijsdojsoij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a new workspace. 3. Go to workspace settings > More features. 4. Disable Workflows. 5. Go to Members and invite a member. 6. Click More > Download CSV. 7. Create another workspace and also disable Workflows in workspace settings > More features. 8. Go to Members. 9. Click More > Import spreadsheet. 10. Upload the CSV from Step 6. 11. Click Import. ## Expected Result: - User should not be forced to upgrade when the CSV file does not contain additional approver or additional workflow. - After upgrading to enable "Advanced Approvals", Workflows should be enabled. ## Actual Result: - User is forced to upgrade when the CSV file does not contain additional approver or additional workflow. - After upgrading to enable "Advanced Approvals", Workflows is still disabled. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/710ec524-90c6-4b2c-88b0-5aa3d7dd3ea5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
